head.title: World Briefing | Asia: Pakistan: U.S. Helicopter May Have Taken Fire

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Asia: Pakistan: U.S. Helicopter May Have Taken Fire

abstract.p: United States Army helicopter providing earthquake relief in Pakistani-controlled area of Kashmir may have been fired on by rocket-propelled grenade; helicopter was not hit and Pakistani officials believe blast may have been from dynamite being used to clear roads in area (S)

block.p: A United States Army helicopter aiding the earthquake relief effort reported that it might have been fired on in the Pakistani-controlled part of Kashmir, and both the American military and the Pakistani government are investigating, the American Embassy said. The helicopter, a CH-47 Chinook cargo aircraft, was carrying aid supplies when the crew spotted what appeared to be a rocket-propelled grenade fired from the ground. The helicopter was not hit. Pakistani officials said the helicopter crew might have seen a blast from dynamite being used to clear blocked roads in the area.

A United States Army helicopter aiding the earthquake relief effort reported that it might have been fired on in the Pakistani-controlled part of Kashmir, and both the American military and the Pakistani government are investigating, the American Embassy said. The helicopter, a CH-47 Chinook cargo aircraft, was carrying aid supplies when the crew spotted what appeared to be a rocket-propelled grenade fired from the ground. The helicopter was not hit. Pakistani officials said the helicopter crew might have seen a blast from dynamite being used to clear blocked roads in the area.
